sentences.sentence: A Mother and Her Dead Daughter
A woman had two daughters, one of whom died.
The dead daughter was given a large funeral( 葬礼 ), and many mourners( 吊唁者 ) were hired( 被雇佣 ).
The other daughter was surprised to see so many strangers so sad at the loss of her sister—
in fact, they wept( 哭泣 ) even louder than her mother and herself.
She asked her mother why this was, and her mother replied,
“We, her relatives, have nothing to gain( 得到 ) by crying over her death.
They, however, get paid.”
MORAL: Professionals( 专业人士 ) will always do a better job of anything.
A Musician
A certain man was not a good singer, but he did have a good music-room that made his voice echo( 回响 ) nicely.
He liked to listen to himself singing, and he fell more and more in love with( 爱上 ) the sound of his own voice.
He decided that he was such a good singer that he should sing in public and sell tickets.
However, the audience( 观众 ) hated his singing, and to show the man what they thought of him, threw rotten( 腐烂的 ) fruit at him until he had to leave the stage.
MORAL: We don’t see our own faults( 缺点 ), but our neighbors do.
The Man and His Two Wives
In the old days, a man was allowed to have more wives than one.
A middle-aged man, whose hair was beginning to turn gray, fell in love with two women at once, and married them both.
One was young, and wished her husband to appear as youthful as herself.
The other was older, and wanted her husband to appear more suitable( 适合的 ) for her.
So, while the young one took every chance to pull out( 拔 ) the man's gray hairs,
the old one pulled out( 拔 ) every black hair she could find.
In the end he found that he had not a hair left.
MORAL: Don't try to please two people at once.
The Man and the Lion
A man and a lion travelled together through the forest.
They soon began to argue about which was the strongest and most powerful.
As they were arguing, they passed a statue( 雕像 ) made of stone, which showed, “A lion killed by a man.”
The man said, “See there! How strong we are, and how we win against even the king of beasts( 野兽 ).”
The lion replied, “This statue( 雕像 ) was made by one of you men.
If we lions knew how to make statues( 雕像 ), you would see the man placed under the paw( 爪子 ) of the lion.”
MORAL: Each of us is the hero of our own story.
The Mice and the Cat
Once upon a time, all the mice met together to discuss the best way to protect themselves from( 保护...免受 ) a cat.
After several ideas had been talked about, one of the older mice got up and said, “I think I have a plan which will keep us safe in the future, if you agree to do it.
We should put a bell around the neck of the cat, and the sound will tell us she is coming.”
This idea was warmly accepted.
It had already been decided, when an old mouse got upon his feet and said,
“I agree that the plan is a good one, but may I ask who is going to put the bell on the cat?”
MORAL: It is one thing to think of a good plan, and another to put it into practice.

question.cn: 在故事A Mother and Her Dead Daughter中，谁哭得最大声？
question.en: In the story a Mother and Her Dead Daughter, who cried loudest?

analysis: 文中提到“the other daughter was surprised to see so many strangers so sad at the loss of her sister---in fact, they wept even louder than her mother and herself.”可知，雇佣的吊唁者是哭声最大的，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事A Musician中，观众是否喜欢这个人的歌声？
question.en: In the story a Musician, did the audience like the voice of the man?

analysis: 文中提到“the audience hated his singing, and to show the man what they thought of him, threw rotten fruit at him until he had to leave the stage.”可知，观众们很讨厌这个人的歌声，扔烂水果把他砸下舞台，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Man and His Two Wives中，为什么年轻的妻子要拔掉丈夫的灰白头发？
question.en: In the story The Man and His Two Wives, why did the young wife pull out her husband's gray hairs?

options.cn: 因为她讨厌自己的丈夫。
因为她想让丈夫变成秃子。
options.en: Because she wanted her husband to be bald.

options.cn: 因为她想要自己的丈夫看起来更年轻。
options.en: Because she wanted her husband to appear younger.

analysis: 文中提到“One was young, and wished her husband to appear as youthful as herself ... while the young one took every chance to pull out the man's gray hairs.”可知，为了让她的丈夫看起来更年轻一点，她拔掉了丈夫的灰白头发，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Man and the Lion中，男人和狮子争论什么？
question.en: What did the man and the lion argue about in the story the Man and the Lion?

analysis: 文中提到“They soon began to argue about which was the strongest and more powerful.”他们争论的主题为谁更加强壮，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Mice and the Cat中，老鼠们的计划是什么？
question.en: In the story the Mice and the Cat, what plan did the mice have?

options.cn: 在猫脖子上系上一个铃铛。
options.en: To tie a bell around the cat’s neck.
To find a dog to get rid of the cat.

analysis: 文中提到“We should put a bell around the neck of the cat, and the sound will tell us she is coming.”可知，老鼠们的计划是在猫脖子上系上一个铃铛，因此选A。
